intro: Moldenhawera riedelii, commonly known as the Riedel's moldenhawera, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its unique rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding structure, typical of bromeliads. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing on tree trunks or in rocky crevices. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
